metadata.unit_type: Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Auto-transportable Infantry Division, North Africa Type)

narrative.title: Bologna Division - 1940Q3
narrative.unit_type: Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Auto-transportable Infantry Division, North Africa Type)
narrative.situation: Italian Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Auto-transportable Infantry Division, North Africa Type) deployed in North Africa during 1940Q3.
narrative.objectives: Standard infantry division for defensive operations and garrison duty in North African theater. Auto-transportable designation allows movement by motor transport but not simultaneous transport of all elements. Training phase in Q3 1940 prior to Egyptian invasion.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: coastal plain and rocky desert (Tripolitania region)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Light tank battalion provides limited mobile firepower
Eliminated pack animals in favor of motor transport (AS type)
Enhanced mobility compared to metropolitan divisions

environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (Tripolitania region)
